snippet: The percentage of doctors accepting new Medicare patients is rising, not falling.
abstract: Editorial highlights an analysis by experts at the Department of Health and Human Services that shows that the percentage of doctors accepting new Medicare patients has actually risen from 2005 to 2012; contends the finding should demolish claims made by those who call for radical changes to Medicare, who have made exaggerated claims to the contrary.
lead_paragraph: The percentage of doctors accepting new Medicare patients is rising, not falling.
